title: Idolatry Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Idolatry
description: Test your knowledge of the 40 biblical commandments related to idolatry. Covers 2 positive and 38 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids making an idol for yourself?
options: Do not make an idol for yourself
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not inquire into idolatry
Do not make a covenant with idolaters
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make an idol for yourself
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 explicitly prohibits making an idol for oneself as stated in Exodus 20:4.

questions.question: Which of the following is a positive commandment in the Idolatry category?
options: Burn a city that has turned to idol worship
Do not inquire of spirits
Do not make an idol for others
Do not derive benefit from idols and their accessories
questions.correctAnswer: Burn a city that has turned to idol worship
questions.explanation: Commandment #33 is one of only two positive commandments in the Idolatry category, commanding the burning of a city that has turned to idol worship (Deuteronomy 13:17).

questions.question: According to Exodus 20:5, what is the reason given for not worshiping idols in the four ways we worship God?
options: Because the LORD your God is a jealous God
Because idols are made of wood and stone
Because idols lead to poverty
Because idols are forbidden only on the Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD your God is a jealous God
questions.explanation: Commandments #27 and #28 state that we must not worship idols as we worship God because the LORD is a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on their children (Exodus 20:5).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids deriving benefit from idols and their accessories?
options: Do not derive benefit from idols and their accessories
Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not consult ghosts or spirits
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city that has been burned
questions.correctAnswer: Do not derive benefit from idols and their accessories
questions.explanation: Commandment #54 forbids deriving benefit from idols and their accessories as stated in Deuteronomy 7:26.

questions.question: What is prohibited by the commandment found in Leviticus 19:31?
options: Do not inquire of spirits
Do not make an idol for yourself
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship God
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city that has been burned
questions.correctAnswer: Do not inquire of spirits
questions.explanation: Commandment #47 prohibits inquiring of spirits to avoid defilement, as stated in Leviticus 19:31.

questions.question: Which commandment requires the destruction of idols and their places of worship?
options: Destroy idols and their accessories
Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols
Do not make a covenant with idolaters
Do not save an idolater from execution
questions.correctAnswer: Destroy idols and their accessories
questions.explanation: Commandment #53 commands to utterly destroy all places where nations serve their gods (Deuteronomy 12:2).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes' is found in Exodus 20:23.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #31 states this prohibition in Exodus 20:23.

questions.question: True or False: It is permitted to rebuild a city that was burned because it turned to idol worship.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #34 forbids rebuilding an idolatrous city once it has been burned (Deuteronomy 13:17).

questions.question: True or False: Consulting magicians or seers is allowed according to Leviticus 19:31.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #48 prohibits consulting magicians or seers (Leviticus 19:31).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not swear in the name of an idol' is found in Exodus 23:13.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #46 forbids swearing in the name of an idol as stated in Exodus 23:13.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids passing children through the fire to Molech?
options: Do not pass your children through the fire to Molech
Do not love those who entice others into idolatry
Do not inquire into idolatry
Do not engage in astrology
questions.correctAnswer: Do not pass your children through the fire to Molech
questions.explanation: Commandment #49 forbids giving offspring to Molech, a form of idolatrous child sacrifice (Leviticus 18:21).

questions.question: The commandment 'Do not inquire into idolatry' is found in which book and chapter?
options: Leviticus 19:4
Exodus 20:4
Deuteronomy 13:9
Leviticus 19:31
questions.correctAnswer: Leviticus 19:4
questions.explanation: Commandment #24 states 'Do not inquire into idolatry' in Leviticus 19:4.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids making a covenant with idolaters?
options: Do not make a covenant with idolaters
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not consult ghosts or spirits
Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols
questions.correctAnswer: Do not make a covenant with idolaters
questions.explanation: Commandment #56 forbids making covenants with idolaters (Deuteronomy 7:2).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids imitating idolaters in customs and clothing?
options: Do not imitate idolaters in customs and clothing
Do not inquire of spirits
Do not make an idol for others
Do not bow down on smooth stone
questions.correctAnswer: Do not imitate idolaters in customs and clothing
questions.explanation: Commandment #59 prohibits following the customs of idolaters including clothing (Leviticus 20:23).

questions.question: Which commandment commands not to save an idolater from execution?
options: Do not save an idolater from execution
Do not cease hating an idolater
Do not say anything in an idolater's defense
Do not refrain from incriminating an idolater
questions.correctAnswer: Do not save an idolater from execution
questions.explanation: Commandment #39 commands that an idolater must not be saved from execution (Deuteronomy 13:9).

questions.question: What is forbidden by the commandment in Deuteronomy 18:10 regarding magic and divination?
options: Do not perform acts of magic
Do not worship idols in the manner they are worshiped
Do not derive benefit from idols
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city
questions.correctAnswer: Do not perform acts of magic
questions.explanation: Commandment #67 forbids performing acts of magic or witchcraft (Deuteronomy 18:10).

questions.question: According to Deuteronomy 7:25, what must one do regarding ornaments of idols?
options: Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols
Destroy the ornaments and keep the silver
Use the ornaments for sacred purposes
Sell the ornaments to outsiders
questions.correctAnswer: Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols
questions.explanation: Commandment #55 forbids coveting or taking silver or gold from idols' ornaments (Deuteronomy 7:25).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The commandment to '_____ idols and their accessories' is found in Deuteronomy 12:2.
options: Destroy
Build
Honor
Consult
questions.correctAnswer: Destroy
questions.explanation: Commandment #53 commands to destroy idols and their accessories (Deuteronomy 12:2).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'You shall not make for yourself an _____, or any likeness of what is in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the water under the earth' (Exodus 20:4).
options: idol
altar
offering
sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: idol
questions.explanation: Commandment #29 prohibits making any idol for oneself (Exodus 20:4).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids drinking wine poured in service to idols?
options: Do not drink wine poured in service to idols
Do not pass your children through the fire to Molech
Do not prophesy falsely in the name of God
Do not inquire into idolatry
questions.correctAnswer: Do not drink wine poured in service to idols
questions.explanation: Commandment #203 forbids drinking wine used in idol worship (Deuteronomy 32:38).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids bowing down on smooth stone, to avoid idolatrous practices?
options: Do not bow down on smooth stone
Do not inquire of spirits
Do not make human forms even for decorative purposes
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city
questions.correctAnswer: Do not bow down on smooth stone
questions.explanation: Commandment #51 forbids bowing down on smooth stone as it relates to idolatry (Leviticus 26:1).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids swearing in the name of an idol?
options: Do not swear in the name of an idol
Do not inquire into idolatry
Do not consult magicians or seers
Do not derive benefit from idols
questions.correctAnswer: Do not swear in the name of an idol
questions.explanation: Commandment #46 forbids swearing by the name of idols (Exodus 23:13).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids loving those who entice others into idolatry?
options: Do not love those who entice others into idolatry
Do not save an idolater from execution
Do not worship idols in the four ways we worship God
Do not inquire of spirits
questions.correctAnswer: Do not love those who entice others into idolatry
questions.explanation: Commandment #37 forbids loving those who entice others to idolatry (Deuteronomy 13:9).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not cease hating an idolater' directs that hatred must be maintained as long as the idolater lives.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #38 commands continuous hatred towards idolaters (Deuteronomy 13:9).

questions.question: True or False: Commandments concerning idolatry include prohibitions against astrology and soothsaying.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandments #60 and #62 forbid astrology and soothsaying (Leviticus 19:26).
